title: Jardiniere
text: History frequently plays a part in design sensibility. In America, the influence of English gardens and Indian textiles has had a major impact on their respective areas. <I>Jardini√©re<I> is reminiscent of shawl fabrics produced in Northern India at the beginning of the 19th century, but the use of a satin striped, print groundcloth references concerns relating to issues of light and shadow that are so important to all areas of design.
description: Machine printed black twill cotton and silk weave with a geometrizied floral pattern on a broad vertically striped  background Machine printed black twill cotton and silk weave with a geometrizied floral pattern (green, red, grey, beige) on a broad vertically striped pale yellow and pale pink background azalea
